job_description:
Quality Assurance Engineer
Experienced QA Engineers —bring your experience to work for you where people love to shop! Boscov's is a chain of full service department stores serving the total family needs of our customers. For over 100 years, Boscov's has been known for its great values and famous brands, and for offering a broad selection of quality merchandise in its stores and online. We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team.
As part of a fast-paced, dynamic Information Technology team, you will support various areas of the business by helping to deliver quality IT solutions working closing with Business and Development teams. If you are looking for a great opportunity to pursue a rewarding career with a company known for quality and big savings, apply today!
Responsibilities
Work with the technical team members to deliver features and new systems
Create test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure software quality
Collaborate with end users and business stakeholders to perform User Acceptance Testing
Work with project managers and development team to identify, track and resolve defects
Assess the functionality, performance of applications and their interactivity based on the acceptance criteria of systems and features
Identify cross-system data needs and validate integrity across systems for the proper end-to-end UAT environments
Perform a series of positive and negative test cases to identify issues proactively
Participate in post-launch validations in production environments
Qualifications
Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Strong knowledge of tooling to report defects and document test plans
Experience with load testing tools
Experience with python or other programming language, a plus
Detailed individual who is able to work independently and within the group
Experience with retail systems, a plus
Strong knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Benefits
At Boscov’s, we value our employees, and that’s why we provide a competitive compensation and benefits package. As a member of our IT team, you will be eligible to receive:
Competitive starting rate
Weekly Pay
Comprehensive benefits package, including medical/dental/vision
Paid Vacations and Personal days
Liberal Employee Discounts
Much More!
Work where people love to shop!
Equal Opportunity Employer
#INDMAIN

Essential Functions
Lead a team of 4 direct report QA Technicians providing quality support on 3 shifts in a 24 hr per day operation.
Lead projects related to process equipment, control systems reliability improvements, optimization, system upgrades and implementation of new equipment control systems.
Develop process specifications and standard operating procedures for production lines throughout the plant maximizing production efficiency and reliability, including material flow, project plans and production capacity.
Maintain and calibrate all testing equipment that come in contact with product, tapes, calipers, etc.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions for issues surfaced through quality complaints on non-conforming product, conduct and assist with quality training sessions.
Support manufacturing processes in all production departments for throughput improvement, yield improvement and determine KPI’s.
Determine process consistency and capability (Cpk), analyze and distribute quality metrics.
Track customer returns, internal defects, test yields, scrap, downtime reports and other non-conforming conditions and report the status and corrective action to management.
Maintain database for QMS, develop and implement SOP’s, ensure they are revised and up to date.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Administrative
Track quality concerns from customers and production and conduct follow-through for timely resolutions.
Support preparation for successful Cardinal IG Process Audit and industry certifications for IGCC and SGCC.
Order and maintain tools, measuring devices and special processes used in quality related procedures.
Engage Cardinal IG Tech Center for process and material review to ensure Cardinal IG product durability.
Respond to customer inquiries regarding product and quality matters.
Performs other related duties, as required.

Education & Experience
4-year bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Quality, Manufacturing, or related field
5+ years of experience in general industry quality or related field required- production, or manufacturing environment preferred.

Additional Preferred Qualifications and Certifications
Six Sigma Green Belt (SSGB) certification
Experience with the practical application of quality tools, Six Sigma, and Lean Manufacturing methodologies
Knowledge of Quality Management Systems such as ISO-9001
Familiarity with the glazing industry and associated industry standards
Prior experience facilitating training sessions and quality management programs.

Reporting Responsibility: Quality Manager
Starting Pay: Depending on Experience
#ORHRIG

As a Weld Engineer, you will be reponsible for efficiency improvements in manual/robotic welding, spot-welding, brazing and metal finish through the use of technology and improved methods. This position has the responsibility for compliance with all customer weld specifications and programs. This position is also responsible for teaching, training and continuous improvements in all areas related to welding.
Responsibilities: This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as deemed necessary.
Issues written setup and process sheets documenting settings and welding parameters for welding operations
Create and monitor weld tests for qualification of welders
Review and analyze customer part prints, specifications and other documentation to aid in production quotations covering the welding of product. This will include production rates, set-up time, and tooling requirements
Work with the Process Engineers to develop, review and maintain production welding set-up specs
Recommend method revisions including process equipment, materials and tooling to improve production performances and provide cost reduction opportunities
Confer with Project Engineers and Manufacturing to provide technical advice and problem resolution
Know and provide welder training in weld symbols, use of weld gages, defect identification and resolution
Identify and make proposals for new technology related to welding processes.
Develop ROI’s related to new technology recommendations
Monitor and develop CI plans related to increasing “green light” time on robotic welding equipment
Support NPI related to the welding processes
Perform weld station audits and drive corrective actions where necessary
Determine methods of rework when necessary
Support RCCA related to welding processes
Qualifications:
Ability to read 2D and 3D drawings and customer specifications
Knowledge of MS Office and ERP systems
Knowledge of methods/time studies and ability to calculate run rates
Capability to determine the most cost-effective method to weld parts
Ability to use a calculator
Ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills
Detail oriented
Ability to learn the MEC system and to use it to determine welding standards and cost justifications
Knowledge of welding fixtures and jigs and tooling is very beneficial
CWI Certification is a plus
Job Types: Permanent, Full-time
Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

About us
Monroe is an AS9100D / ISO9001:2015 certified global distribution and manufacturing company offering a broad product line across a diverse customer base in several markets including aerospace/defense, automotive, medical, and transportation. Our Monroe team lives by a simple question, "How can we help?" Monroe has grown with so many customers because we were never afraid to help a customer attack an issue to get it solved correctly, quickly, and in an efficient manner. We continually expand our standard product offering based on the needs of our customers and have expanded our contract manufacturing capabilities to offer more custom solutions than ever before.
Key Responsibilties
Use knowledge obtained from design specifications/part drawings and customer quality manual to generate the documents.
Work with supply base to communicate PPAP and testing requirements as specified by design/specifications and or customer quality manual
Participate in generating and maintaining work instructions associated to ISO 9001 requirements
Support and actively participate in implementing and maintaining QMS ISO 9001 Management system
Support and actively participate in completing customer compliance audits
Evaluate and assess equipment and software needs associated to the tasks above
Contribute to supplier evaluation and development as needed
Desired Qualifications and Skills
Highly proficient with standard office products such as MS Outlook, Excel, and Word
Able to navigate file folders and manage electronic data with ease
Experience with military contracts (DFAR, ITAR, Export Control), and ISO 9001
Strong understanding of the basic principles of geometry
Experience and good understanding of AIAG, APQP, PPAP, and FMEA tools
Recent experience using the following tools and instruments: calipers, micrometers, optical comparator, thread gages and ring gages
Self-motivated
Detail oriented
Professional
Able to delegate and manage multiple projects

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
Provides inspection service to support manufacturing/engineering requests. Ensures adequate and accurate inspection for incoming components and special requests. Coordinates timely disposition of rejected raw materials. Gives direction to Quality Technicians and Parts Inspectors.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordinates non-standard inspections and folder updates, evaluates lab capabilities vs. requests.
Maintains and updates electronic check sheets per drawing and/or HY specification changes.
Non-conforming material: Pursues disposition of material; communicates requests for material returns with suppliers; sends samples; locates material within Oracle; maintains NCR log and documents; coordinates third party inspection.
Initiates and processes supplier chargebacks.
Maintains proficiency and competency testing for Quality Lab personnel. Monitors adherence to requirements of 17025 and TS16949.
Provides direction and scheduling for lab personnel.
Directs 6S activities; assists with inspections and follows up material paperwork issues.
Coordinates and identifies material per inspection zone requirements.
Coordinates post receiving alerts.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS*:
Bachelor’s degree in related field, preferred* plus a minimum of three years supervisory and quality experience required. Demonstrable knowledge of optical inspection machine, calipers, micrometers, indicators, optical comparator, and height gage required. Regulatory and Quality System requirements/standards knowledge required. Requires excellent communication skills both verbal and written, with attention to detail. Must be computer literate and have ability to manage multiple priorities.
Any equivalent combination of experience and training which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities may be substituted.
WORK ENVIRONMENT / CONDITIONS / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Work will take place in a combination office/shop environment. Employee may be required to work weekends, holidays, and be on-call on occasion. While performing the duties of this job, employees may be exposed to mechanical or chemical processes requiring the use of personnel protective equipment.
These are considered essential duties and are illustrative of those job tasks that are fundamental. Employees may be required to perform additional related duties as may be assigned by management. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Be a part of an excellent healthcare organization that cares about our People, Quality, Patient Safety, Service, and Integrity. Join a team that has a mission to improve health every day and a vision to be the healthcare choice of the communities that we serve!
Sentara Health Plan is hiring for a QA Engineer for Sentara Health Plans.
This is a Full-Time position, fully remote, with day shift hours and great benefits!
Work Location:
Candidates may work remotely in - Alabama, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Indiana, Kansas, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Minnesota, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington (state), West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming
Job Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented QA Engineer to join our Quality Assurance (QA) team. This role is responsible for the Enrollment Testing Strategy, Test Plans, Test Cases and Test Execution. Candidate should be familiar with Medicare, Medicaid and Commercial Enrollment using QNXT. The QA Engineer's responsibilities but include the following:
Develop Test Strategy, Test Plans and Test Cases
Execute Test Cases
Create and Manage Defects
Train and developer other QA Engineers
Adhere to Testing Center of Excellent standards

Preferred to have Bachelor's Level Degree
Experience in lieu of Bachelor's Degree
Required to have experience with QNXT
Required to have experience working knowledge of Enrollment processes
Required to have experience with JIRA
Required to have experience with SQL
Required to have 5+ years of related work experience
Excellent Oral and Written Communication Skills
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred to have automation background
Benefits: Sentara offers an attractive array of full-time benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off, Sick, Tuition Reimbursement, a 401k/403B, 401a, Performance Plus Bonus, Career Advancement Opportunities, Work Perks, and more.
For information about our employee benefits, please visit: Benefits – Sentara (sentaracareers.com)
Sentara Health Plans is the health insurance division of Sentara Healthcare doing business as Optima Health and Virginia Premier.
Sentara Health Plans provides health insurance coverage through a full suite of commercial products including consumer-driven, employee-owned and employer-sponsored plans, individual and family health plans, employee assistance plans and plans serving Medicare and Medicaid enrollees.
With more than 30 years’ experience in the insurance business and 20 years’ experience serving Medicaid populations, we offer programs to support members with chronic illnesses, customized wellness programs, and integrated clinical and behavioral health services – all to help our members improve their health.

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
Working at Abbott
At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:
Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
Free medical coverage for employees* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO
· An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution · Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.
For years, Abbott’s medical device businesses have offered technologies that are faster, more effective, and less invasive. Whether it’s glucose monitoring systems, innovative therapies for treating heart disease, or products that help people with chronic pain or movement disorders, our medical device technologies are designed to help people live their lives better and healthier. Every day, our technologies help more than 10,000 people have healthier hearts, improve quality of life for thousands of people living with chronic pain and movement disorders, and liberate more than 5 million people with diabetes globally from routine ﬁngersticks.
The Opportunity
Abbott Diabetes Care is currently looking for a QA Engineer. This individual will analyze quality standards for components, materials or services. Apply measures, sampling methods, testing methodology and other procedures that ensure that quality standards are met.
What You’ll Work On
Apply quality principles, analyzes quality records, prepares reports and recommends improvements.
Conduct inspection, verification and validation of components or materials used in development processes.
Identify and address recurring problems either with the quality of the product or the reliability of testing procedures.
Document quality issues and performance measures for management review.
May liaise with external vendors.
Required Qualifications
Associates Degree
Minimum 1 year experience
Apply Now
Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.
Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

The base pay for this position is $65,200.00 – $130,400.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

Night position. Hours M-F 7:00 PM to 5:30 AM
Monitor and improve the quality of our operational processes and outputs. The Quality Engineer’s responsibilities include: designing quality standards; inspecting materials, equipment processes, and products; developing quality control systems; determining corrective actions. You will also work with managers and supervisors to implement quality measures.
A successful Quality Engineer should have excellent troubleshooting skills and be able to ensure that processes and products consistently meet established quality standards.

Quality Engineer Responsibilities:
Developing and implementing quality standards.
Developing and implementing quality control systems.
Monitoring and analyzing quality performance.
Inspecting and testing materials, equipment, processes, and products to ensure quality specifications are met.
Collaborating with managers to develop and implement controls and improvements.
Ensuring that workflows, processes, and products comply with safety regulations.
Investigating and troubleshooting product or productions issues.
Developing corrective actions, solutions, and improvements.
Reviewing codes, specifications, and processes.
Degree in quality, industrial, or mechanical engineering.
ASQ certification preferred.
2+ years of experience in quality engineering, quality assurance, or a similar role.
Experience coding and using QA software tools and processes.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent project management skills.

***US Citizens or Green Card Holders***
***W2 Only***
Skills Required:
Must have both Web and Mobile testing experience.
Must have automation experience, but this position is 50/50 automation and manual testing.
Looking for candidates with preferably 8-10+ years of experience.
Testing or quality assurance role within an Agile environment.
Experience within the financial services industry in either a technical or business capacity.
Experience working with resources located globally, including outsourced or contracted colleagues.
Experience automating test scenarios.
Experience translating performance testing requirements into meaningful and executable test scenarios.

Job Description
We are looking for a results-driven software tester to be responsible for designing and running tests on software usability. The software tester will conduct tests, analyze the results, and report observations to the design team. You may also interact with clients in order to understand the requirements of the product. You will be working closely with web and app teams to deliver bug-free applications to the clients.
Responsibilities
- Reviewing software requirements and preparing test scenarios.
- Executing tests on software usability. - Analyzing test results on database impacts, errors or bugs, and usability.
- Preparing reports on all aspects related to the software testing carried out and reporting to the design team.
- Interacting with clients to understand product requirements.
- Participating in design reviews and providing input on requirements, product design, and potential problems.
Skills
- Up-to-date knowledge of software test design and testing methodologies.
- Working knowledge of test techniques and compatibility with various software programs.
- Knowledge of bug tracking tool like JIRA, bugheard, etc. - Working knowledge of programming.
- Excellent communication and critical thinking skills.
- Good organizational skills and detail-oriented mindset.
Key Skill:
A complete understanding of the writing and executing tests on mobile and web applications.

About Kanini
Kanini provides Agile Software Development, Cloud Computing, Data Science, and Location Intelligence services to public and private organizations. We have successfully served our clients in government, finance, transportation, utility, and software industries since 2003.
Why you should join
Working at Kanini is flexible and personal. We are a highly motivated, collaborative team experimenting with the latest technologies. We are committed to everyone having a healthy work/life balance, and we provide extensive mentorship and training resources to help you succeed.
Kanini is looking for an QA Lead Tester who has a deep experience in Regression Testing, Integration testing, and Web and Cloud Applications Testing.
Responsibilities
Responsible for driving software testing lifecycles on a Scrum teams while providing strong technical and analytical skills to deliver with quality.
Lead the design of Test plans, Test Scenarios, Creation, and execution of test cases.
Analyzing bugs and facilitating bug/defect lifecycle and interacting with development team members in fixing the defects.
Participating in Sprint planning and performing test planning to ensure delivery meets the need of the Sprint.
Manage all testing activities as part of testing lifecycle from planning to execution.
Conducting training sessions to offshore team members as needed on product or processes.
Timely reviews of test plans, test scripts and results to ensure optimal requirement and code coverage.
Responsible for planning and conducting test execution, managing test cases, raising bugs, and ensuring no blockages during the testing process.
Regular reporting on issues identified during testing activities and their resolution for any needed corrective actions.
Collaborate with different teams including offshore to understand test and automation needs as part of development cycle.
Required Experience
Minimum of 5 -10 years of QA Automation experience with 4-5+ years of Leadership experience
Strong experience testing APIs and databases.
Experience with creating UAT scripts to end users of business entities.
Demonstrate working understanding of the Scrum/Agile/SAFe Methodologies and defect management process.
Experience in daily test reporting/monitoring and identifying risks.
Fluent with Bug and Defect lifecyles.
Demonstrate working understanding of Database testing skills like writing simple queries to validate the data.
Ability to Mentor QA Teams and assigning work.
Should have a strong balance of technical and a proven history of good work across large scale applications.
Strong communication skills regarding technical topics and remote collaboration skills are critical to this role.

WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. QUALITY ASSURANCE
What We Do
The Quality Assurance team owns the testing process, risk management, and quality evaluation of all products and functions across Epic. Our team works closely with developers and production to ensure the best possible user experience for our community and customers.
What You'll Do
People within the QA Engineer career track work with product owners, developers, and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features/releases. You will develop and implement automation test strategies and utilize technical tooling to expand breadth and add depth to QA coverage of multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You will facilitate functional, qualitative, and performance testing efforts while using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze and report on quality. You are expected to work in a highly autonomous environment embedded on a specific team or product while working closely with designers, engineers, and production staff, using a combination of quality assurance, data analysis, and technical skills to drive appropriate testing techniques early on in development through release cycles and beyond.
In this role, you will
Working with product owners, developers and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features / releases
Examine technical gaps and automation initiatives between geographically distributed teams, vendors and agencies to deliver the highest quality product
Building test strategies and test plans to cover multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze the quality of said product while troubleshooting reported defects and internal issues
Reporting and tracking for data quality, and using that data to drive conversations around product quality and development health, supporting developers before, during, and after deployments
Test communications between the client and backend services
What we're looking for
3+ years of professional QA experience
2+ years professional coding experience or Computer Science Bachelor’s Degree
Previous experience creating tools or automation using Python, C++ and/or C#
Experience working in and/or with UE4/UE5
Experience with root cause analysis of defects
Previous experience working with data and/or analytics preferred but not required
Strong communication skills and ability to confidently collaborate with senior members on technical topics and features
Software/games testing experience in a fast paced environment
Technical understanding of web, mobile, XR, or game technologies, including automation, functional, qualitative, and performance against consistently iterative development

Job Title: Supplier Quality Engineer
Department: Quality Assurance
Reports To: Quality Assurance Manager/Purchasing Manager
SUMMARY OF POSITION
The Supplier Quality Engineer will report directly to the Quality Manager with indirect report to the Purchasing Manager. The SQE is responsible for development of the supply base, including but not limited to improvement in process quality, delivery, and supplier performance metrics. The SQE will work with the Champion supply base assisting in manufacturing process control improvements, error proofing, and PFMEA development. Additional responsibilities include root cause analysis of quality escapes resulting from purchased products, productivity improvements, FAIR reviews of purchased product, issuing and reviewing corrective action requests of suppliers and on-site audits of the supply base. Expected travel is 30%-50%.
The SQE will be responsible for quality inputs and outputs from the development stage through the life of the product, working with the assigned quality and manufacturing engineers to the specific product line.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Work with quality and purchasing in identifying key suppliers and improve the delivery and quality metrics of those suppliers.
2. Coordinate and lead on site audits at the supply chain sites.
3. Determine the need for corrective action requests with follow up visits to ensure effective implementation.
4. Collect and analyze process data and supplier performance history to identify chronic supply chain deficits and correct problems for trends leading to opportunities for improvement projects and cost reduction.
5. Develop and improve procedures controlling the outsourcing process to improve the effectiveness and FPY of purchased product.
6. Organize and lead Improvement Projects to refine process control, correct process problems, reduce scrap, and improve on time delivery.
7. Monitor supply base KPI’s and report monthly to Champion leadership, develop and monitor supplier scorecards for key Champion suppliers.
8. Work with the Champion receiving inspection to develop quality plans and review supplier FAIR submissions.
9. Work with the Purchasing and Quality Managers on supplier selection and development.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
B.S. in Engineering, Management, or Technology.
Minimum Three (3) years Supplier Quality Engineering/Development experience; Automotive or Aerospace industry experience a plus.
Must have experience in APQP, PPAP, PFMEA, GD&T, FAIR and formal problem solving methodology.
Good written and verbal communication skill.

SUMMARY
Provides leadership as well as the tools to continuously improve quality. Functions as a change agent in moving quality processes & initiatives forward. Establishes, manages, and implements quality initiatives, systems & measures by driving a culture of quality. Champions the PGTI Quality Management System (QMS) that delivers high-quality industry-leading PGTI products and services. Manages change and improvement efforts that support the production of exceptional products. While achieving high first pass yields and delivering products on time. Supports PGTI strategic initiatives across all product lines within the PGT Venice manufacturing and glass production environments.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create/lead a diverse technical team that proactively assures sustainable quality processes and systems in all aspects of the Venice campus operations including design, manufacturing, delivery, supply chain, and service of the company products.
Achieve industry-leading Customer Facing Quality Performance by working closely with the sales and operations team to intimately understand customer issues.
Knowledgeable and experienced in maintaining ISO9001-compliant quality program.
Ability to continuously improve new product development (NPD) processes that yield effective product roll-outs.
Maintain and manage the PGT quality standards using effective document and data control methodologies.
Review products, processes, and systems on an ongoing basis to determine where improvements can be made.
Partner with the operations team to establish an effective manufacturing process to ensure quality and high first pass yield.
Actively participate in production meetings with the manufacturing team.
Gathers information on employees’ perceptions of the Company’s cultural and systemic barriers and provides interventions that support the achievement of quality in all facets of the business.
Attuned to leading approaches to improve quality by utilizing an appropriate tool chest of approaches, such as: TQM, RCA, SPC, Six Sigma, Design of Experiments, FMEA, etc.
Identifies opportunities for improvement and works to engage appropriate areas/resources to determine responses.
Works with Sales, Service (Customer & Field), Engineering, and Manufacturing to establish and document in-process and finished goods quality acceptance criteria. Ensures acceptance criteria are understood and followed by all parties involved in designing, building, shipping, and installing company products.
Works with Engineering and Manufacturing on product specifications to ensure quality and reliability of finished products. This includes design as well as manufacturing process requirements.
Ensures Process Automation, New Line Processing, and Line reprocessing meet established acceptance capability (CpK) criteria. Collaborates with Engineering and Manufacturing to establish and support equipment buy-off procedures and production line pilots or line trials.
Ensures a consistent approach to manufacturing company products. Works with Engineering and Manufacturing to develop consistent implementation processes and plans including: Production Assembly Documents if appropriate and control audits.
Works with Materials Management and company suppliers to leverage partnerships and strategic alliances to ensure quality of all services, purchased parts, and materials for company use as well as establishing appropriate containment and receiving inspection criteria and procedures.
Develops processes and procedures to verify that products are meeting established quality acceptance criteria. Establishes “Quality Assurance” as the first line of defense for production root cause analysis and establishment of containment procedures, utilizing Product Engineering as required.
Leads teams engaged in inspection, testing, and auditing activities to ensure continuous control over materials, facilities, and products.
Plays an active role in bringing the Voice of the Customer (VOC) to plant management teams within the PGT Venice manufacturing facilities.
Provides guidance and leadership to subordinate leaders and team personnel to help them effectively plan work, lead team activities, and establish priorities. Plans and maintains a continual work schedule for department personnel that supports the 24/7 manufacturing environment.
The incumbent needs the capability of prioritizing workload and delegating appropriately to deliver results.
Incumbent to be an “agile leader” who can deal with not only day-to-day demands while working to strategically to move the organization to best industry practices.
Other duties may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations, or related field. Advanced degrees in Quality Management or MBA would be beneficial in this role.
10 or more years of experience in continuous quality improvement, encompassing quality assurance and quality control from an enterprise-wide standpoint.
At least 5 years of leadership experience in a manufacturing environment.
Knowledge of Six Sigma, Quality Systems, SPC, and FMEA.
Ability to drive root cause analysis.
Must possess excellent interpersonal skills.
Must possess an intermediate or better level of competence using all MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
LANGUAGE/COMMUNICATION SKILLS:
Ability to work and communicate effectively with all levels and functional areas of the business.
Must possess above-average presentation and facilitation skills.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
College-level mathematical skills including the ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts including statistical analysis (frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory, and factor analysis).
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables. Must be able to analyze situations promptly and accurately. Must have ability to handle multiple tasks. Excellent problem-solving and analytical decision-making skills. Ability to form good judgments in critical situations. Must be able to deliver results through others.
CERTIFICATE, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Quality Engineer (CQE) and/or Manager of Quality Organizational Excellence (CMQ/OE) Certifications are preferred.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Usual office environment with frequent sitting, walking, and standing, and occasional climbing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, crawling, and balancing.
Frequent exposure to manufacturing environment with variable noise levels and seasonal levels of humidity.
Frequent use of eye, hand, and finger coordination enabling the use of office machinery.
Oral and auditory capacity enabling interpersonal communication as well as communication through automated devices such as the telephone.
TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to travel occasionally domestically.

Provides inspection service to support manufacturing/engineering requests. Ensures adequate and accurate inspection for incoming components and special requests. Coordinates timely disposition of rejected raw materials. Gives direction to Quality Technicians and Parts Inspectors.

Coordinates non-standard inspections and folder updates, evaluates lab capabilities vs. requests.
Maintains and updates electronic check sheets per drawing and/or HY specification changes.
Non-conforming material: Pursues disposition of material; communicates requests for material returns with suppliers; sends samples; locates material within Oracle; maintains NCR log and documents; coordinates third party inspection.
Initiates and processes supplier chargebacks.
Maintains proficiency and competency testing for Quality Lab personnel. Monitors adherence to requirements of 17025 and TS16949.
Provides direction and scheduling for lab personnel.
Directs 6S activities; assists with inspections and follows up material paperwork issues.

Coordinates post receiving alerts.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

Must be computer literate and have ability to manage multiple priorities.

About the Company
Flow aims to create a superior living environment that enhances the lives of our residents and communities by developing, acquiring, owning, and managing multifamily apartment buildings and the services and technology inside those buildings.

Fulfilling our mission will require an exceptional group of people whose collective output is greater than the sum of its individual parts. Our team members are energized by the opportunity to impact our residents’ lives in meaningful ways. They are bold and creatively ambitious, driven by relentlessly high standards, act with a sense of urgency and accountability, and always, above all, operate with integrity, loyalty, and trust.

About the Role
As an early member of our engineering team, you will be the founding quality engineer and will directly contribute to the definition of software quality practices, testing processes, and automation frameworks. This role will combine test case definition, hands-on execution, and the automation of regression tests and tooling. Your work will help us deliver functionality frequently, reliably, and with high quality to residents, building staff, and operations teams.
Responsibilities
Assure quality of new features through requirements feedback and test case definition
Lead, coordinate, and participate in test execution efforts
Report defects, perform bug fix verification, and promote bug prevention
Automate end-to-end regression tests via the mobile app, backend regression tests via the API, and maintain health of resulting automated test suites
Develop test tooling to support testing of complex workflows involving hardware integrations, payments processing, and other tricky targets
Advocate for and promote best Quality Engineering practices across the team
Ideal Background
Experience working in product & operations-heavy organizations
6+ years of software quality assurance engineering experience, including complex software products and mobile applications
Knowledge of QA methodology, industry-standard testing, and bug tracking tools
Test automation expertise in Java or Python using Appium, Selenium or other code-first automation frameworks
Experience developing test strategies, test plans, and test cases
Proven track record of mentoring and guiding other engineers in the implementation of quality best practices
Ability to advocate for quality and enhancing user experience
Ability to collaborate cross functionally and with distributed teams
Experience releasing quality software in fast-moving startup environments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Who Are We?

Looking for a job that makes a real difference in our world today and one that you’ll be proud of when you look back in 20, 30 or 40 years? This is it. Clean Power Research® is advancing the energy transformation through cloud software that informs, streamlines and values energy-related decisions and processes for utilities, energy professionals and consumers.
We’re a growing company that counts 10 of the top 10 Fortune 500 utilities and many of the largest renewable energy companies in the U.S. as our customers. We’re focused on expanding our market reach and impact with new software technologies that help solve the energy industry’s hardest problems.
At Clean Power Research, every employee has a seat at the table and an important role.
Why Work Here?

Go from building solutions to being part of the solution
Join a growing team of software and energy veterans from companies like Microsoft, Amazon, Google, Oracle, General Electric, Pacific Gas & Electric, First Solar, & Nissan
Bring your passion and ideas to the table
Use your creativity to solve hard problems and make tough decisions
Work in a start-up like environment coupled with the stability and customer base of an established, profitable company
Realize work-life balance; we like to see our families, friends and pets at night!
Join a growing company that expects you to grow with us and invests in your growth
Clean Power Research offers competitive compensation and benefits to full-time employees including medical/dental/vision, paid vacation, paid holidays, a bonus plan and 401(k) plan with matching.
What You’ll be Doing as a Data Quality Engineer

The Data Quality Engineer is part of the engineering team and will work closely with software engineers and the Research team. The person in this role will perform the technical analysis of irradiance and weather data, among other data sets, and write test automation to validate existing and new data models for historical and forecast weather data applications to ensure a high quality and accuracy of our datasets. Additionally, the person in this role will analyze and evaluate a multitude of data sources used by our SolarAnywhere® models.
The SolarAnywhere® family of products supports solutions for solar resource assessments, performance monitoring and solar forecasting. This product stands at the forefront of solar prediction for both the utility and solar markets. Our process begins with near real-time satellite imagery, leveraging advanced scientific algorithms to gauge and predict the impact of solar energy on the Earth's surface. SolarAnywhere holds a significant presence across various markets, encompassing utility-scale forecasting and the operational management of rooftop fleets.
Clean Power Research is leveraging these datasets to solve new customer problems. The Data Quality Engineer will identify and research additional data sets, conduct rigorous technical data analysis and collaborate with the team to elevate these data sets in new and existing software products.
The Data Quality Engineer will also provide internal technical support for marketing, sales and business development functions and can represent the company at technical conferences through publications and presentations.
Duties & Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and enhance a comprehensive data quality framework that defines data standards, quality and accuracy expectations, and validation processes.
Implement tools and frameworks for automating the identification of data quality issues.
Validate the output of the SolarAnywhere models to ensure high quality and accuracy of our datasets.
Process, transform, and experiment with high volumes of data to optimize model accuracy.
Apply a procedural framework to assess the performance of a variety of models and quickly identify the most suitable approaches.
Develop and maintain data quality and accuracy dashboards, and scorecards to track data quality and models performance.
Work closely with researchers to automate the validation of models they develop as part of our test and release pipelines.
Write well-structured and maintainable code when developing tools and test automation.
Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in data quality, identify and evangelize opportunities to leverage new approaches and key metrics to validate model changes and continuously monitor model performance.
Identify and validate new data sources to enhance model performance.
Who You Are

BA/BS or MS degree in data science, data analytics, atmospheric sciences, mathematics, statistics, engineering or related field
5+ years of experience in a professional environment having an analytical role involving data analysis techniques and preferably with emphasis on data quality
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to logically and efficiently structure ambiguous problems, identify sources of data, conduct complicated analyses, identify key insights and recommend model improvements
Proficient in using programming languages such as Python, C# and SQL to analyze large datasets
Experience writing test automation for data solutions or analytical products
Skilled in conducting test planning, executing test cases, and performing validation activities
Familiar with advanced techniques in data science, including statistical analysis, data visualization, and some machine learning techniques
Exposure to remote sensing applications, like satellite-based measurement techniques, is a plus
Strong working knowledge of statistics fundamentals and aptitude for working with large data sets to perform statistical analysis
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Superior organizational skills, ability to multitask across several concurrent projects
Passion for clean tech, solar energy or renewables
Pay Range & Benefits

Base Salary Range: $90,000 to $130,000 annual depending on experience
Benefits: Performance-Based Bonus, Company Equity Plan
Additional Benefits: Paid PTO, Sick Time, Holidays, Medical/Dental/Vision/Life and Disability Insurance, 401K, Paternity and Maternity Leave, Commuter Benefits

Job Title: Supplier Quality Engineer
Department: Quality Assurance
Reports To: Quality Assurance Manager/Purchasing Manager
SUMMARY OF POSITION
The Supplier Quality Engineer will report directly to the Quality Manager with indirect report to the Purchasing Manager. The SQE is responsible for development of the supply base, including but not limited to improvement in process quality, delivery, and supplier performance metrics. The SQE will work with the Champion supply base assisting in manufacturing process control improvements, error proofing, and PFMEA development. Additional responsibilities include root cause analysis of quality escapes resulting from purchased products, productivity improvements, FAIR reviews of purchased product, issuing and reviewing corrective action requests of suppliers and on-site audits of the supply base. Expected travel is 30%-50%.
The SQE will be responsible for quality inputs and outputs from the development stage through the life of the product, working with the assigned quality and manufacturing engineers to the specific product line.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Work with quality and purchasing in identifying key suppliers and improve the delivery and quality metrics of those suppliers.
2. Coordinate and lead on site audits at the supply chain sites.
3. Determine the need for corrective action requests with follow up visits to ensure effective implementation.
4. Collect and analyze process data and supplier performance history to identify chronic supply chain deficits and correct problems for trends leading to opportunities for improvement projects and cost reduction.
5. Develop and improve procedures controlling the outsourcing process to improve the effectiveness and FPY of purchased product.
6. Organize and lead Improvement Projects to refine process control, correct process problems, reduce scrap, and improve on time delivery.
7. Monitor supply base KPI’s and report monthly to Champion leadership, develop and monitor supplier scorecards for key Champion suppliers.
8. Work with the Champion receiving inspection to develop quality plans and review supplier FAIR submissions.
9. Work with the Purchasing and Quality Managers on supplier selection and development.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
B.S. in Engineering, Management, or Technology.
Minimum Three (3) years Supplier Quality Engineering/Development experience; Automotive or Aerospace industry experience a plus.
Must have experience in APQP, PPAP, PFMEA, GD&T, FAIR and formal problem solving methodology.
Good written and verbal communication skill.

HP’s vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere — every person, every organization, and every community around the globe. With the heart, creativity, and energy of a startup, and the brain, muscles, and determination of a Fortune 100 corporation, we continue to deliver ground-breaking new technologies to build on our 80+ year legacy of innovation.

Now is a great time to join HP’s Advanced Compute Solutions organization. Our high-performance compute and Emmy-winning remoting software are the foundation for a new Edge business to deliver innovative compute models and workflows to enable hybrid work. As a holistic thinker who is passionate about quality and customer experience, your proven skills to plan, develop, and execute validation will drive success in this role. You will contribute to the overall success of HP solutions.

Your responsibilities will include:
Recommend tools and frameworks based on validation requirements.
Develop automated and manual tests for user experience, performance, functionality, and systems integration.
Own reproduction of customer issues.
Collaborate with internal and outsourced partners to ensure quality across solutions.
Review and evaluate system designs and project activities for compliance with technology and testing guidelines and standards; provide tangible feedback to improve systems and product quality and mitigate risk of defects.
Assist in planning for future growth on the Quality Team.

Required experience and skills:
6+ years of experience with QA, testing tools and test automation for systems integration.
Demonstrated leadership experience in a validation role.
Proficient in scripting and programming languages.
Experience with virtualization, Selenium, Ansible, and Terraform preferred.
Demonstrated ability to update skills to accommodate evolving technology landscape, specifically with cloud, hybrid cloud, private cloud, and bare metal products.
Ability to influence cross functional stakeholders and work with a global team.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.

Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance

Department

Location
Bellevue
Washington, United States
Company
Epic Games
Requisition ID
R24670

WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
QUALITY ASSURANCE
What We Do
The Quality Assurance team owns the testing process, risk management, and quality evaluation of all products and functions across Epic. Our team works closely with developers and production to ensure the best possible user experience for our community and customers.
What You'll Do
People within the QA Engineer career track work with product owners, developers, and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features/releases. You will develop and implement automation test strategies and utilize technical tooling to expand breadth and add depth to QA coverage of multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You will facilitate functional, qualitative, and performance testing efforts while using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze and report on quality. You are expected to work in a highly autonomous environment embedded on a specific team or product while working closely with designers, engineers, and production staff, using a combination of quality assurance, data analysis, and technical skills to drive appropriate testing techniques early on in development through release cycles and beyond.
In this role, you will
Working with product owners, developers and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming features / releases
Examine technical gaps and automation initiatives between geographically distributed teams, vendors and agencies to deliver the highest quality product
Building test strategies and test plans to cover multiple features in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Using a mix of manual and technical testing skills to execute a variety of testing techniques across your product to analyze the quality of said product while troubleshooting reported defects and internal issues
Reporting and tracking for data quality, and using that data to drive conversations around product quality and development health, supporting developers before, during, and after deployments
Test communications between the client and backend services
What we're looking for
3+ years of professional QA experience
2+ years professional coding experience or Computer Science Bachelor’s Degree
Previous experience creating tools or automation using Python, C++ and/or C#
Experience working in and/or with UE4/UE5
Experience with root cause analysis of defects
Previous experience working with data and/or analytics preferred but not required
Strong communication skills and ability to confidently collaborate with senior members on technical topics and features
Software/games testing experience in a fast paced environment
Technical understanding of web, mobile, XR, or game technologies, including automation, functional, qualitative, and performance against consistently iterative development
EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents. Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
Washington Base Pay Range
$97,047—$142,236 USD
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer.
Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party.

SUMMARY
Provides leadership as well as the tools to continuously improve quality. Functions as a change agent in moving quality processes & initiatives forward. Establishes, manages, and implements quality initiatives, systems & measures by driving a culture of quality. Champions the PGTI Quality Management System (QMS) that delivers high-quality industry-leading PGTI products and services. Manages change and improvement efforts that support the production of exceptional products. While achieving high first pass yields and delivering products on time. Supports PGTI strategic initiatives across all product lines within the PGT Venice manufacturing and glass production environments.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create/lead a diverse technical team that proactively assures sustainable quality processes and systems in all aspects of the Venice campus operations including design, manufacturing, delivery, supply chain, and service of the company products.
Achieve industry-leading Customer Facing Quality Performance by working closely with the sales and operations team to intimately understand customer issues.
Knowledgeable and experienced in maintaining ISO9001-compliant quality program.
Ability to continuously improve new product development (NPD) processes that yield effective product roll-outs.
Maintain and manage the PGT quality standards using effective document and data control methodologies.
Review products, processes, and systems on an ongoing basis to determine where improvements can be made.
Partner with the operations team to establish an effective manufacturing process to ensure quality and high first pass yield.
Actively participate in production meetings with the manufacturing team.
Gathers information on employees’ perceptions of the Company’s cultural and systemic barriers and provides interventions that support the achievement of quality in all facets of the business.
Attuned to leading approaches to improve quality by utilizing an appropriate tool chest of approaches, such as: TQM, RCA, SPC, Six Sigma, Design of Experiments, FMEA, etc.
Identifies opportunities for improvement and works to engage appropriate areas/resources to determine responses.
Works with Sales, Service (Customer & Field), Engineering, and Manufacturing to establish and document in-process and finished goods quality acceptance criteria. Ensures acceptance criteria are understood and followed by all parties involved in designing, building, shipping, and installing company products.
Works with Engineering and Manufacturing on product specifications to ensure quality and reliability of finished products. This includes design as well as manufacturing process requirements.
Ensures Process Automation, New Line Processing, and Line reprocessing meet established acceptance capability (CpK) criteria. Collaborates with Engineering and Manufacturing to establish and support equipment buy-off procedures and production line pilots or line trials.
Ensures a consistent approach to manufacturing company products. Works with Engineering and Manufacturing to develop consistent implementation processes and plans including: Production Assembly Documents if appropriate and control audits.
Works with Materials Management and company suppliers to leverage partnerships and strategic alliances to ensure quality of all services, purchased parts, and materials for company use as well as establishing appropriate containment and receiving inspection criteria and procedures.
Develops processes and procedures to verify that products are meeting established quality acceptance criteria. Establishes “Quality Assurance” as the first line of defense for production root cause analysis and establishment of containment procedures, utilizing Product Engineering as required.
Leads teams engaged in inspection, testing, and auditing activities to ensure continuous control over materials, facilities, and products.
Plays an active role in bringing the Voice of the Customer (VOC) to plant management teams within the PGT Venice manufacturing facilities.
Provides guidance and leadership to subordinate leaders and team personnel to help them effectively plan work, lead team activities, and establish priorities. Plans and maintains a continual work schedule for department personnel that supports the 24/7 manufacturing environment.
The incumbent needs the capability of prioritizing workload and delegating appropriately to deliver results.
Incumbent to be an “agile leader” who can deal with not only day-to-day demands while working to strategically to move the organization to best industry practices.
Other duties may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations, or related field. Advanced degrees in Quality Management or MBA would be beneficial in this role.
10 or more years of experience in continuous quality improvement, encompassing quality assurance and quality control from an enterprise-wide standpoint.
At least 5 years of leadership experience in a manufacturing environment.
Knowledge of Six Sigma, Quality Systems, SPC, and FMEA.
Ability to drive root cause analysis.
Must possess excellent interpersonal skills.
Must possess an intermediate or better level of competence using all MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
LANGUAGE/COMMUNICATION SKILLS:
Ability to work and communicate effectively with all levels and functional areas of the business.
Must possess above-average presentation and facilitation skills.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS
College-level mathematical skills including the ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts including statistical analysis (frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory, and factor analysis).
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables. Must be able to analyze situations promptly and accurately. Must have ability to handle multiple tasks. Excellent problem-solving and analytical decision-making skills. Ability to form good judgments in critical situations. Must be able to deliver results through others.
CERTIFICATE, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
Quality Engineer (CQE) and/or Manager of Quality Organizational Excellence (CMQ/OE) Certifications are preferred.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Usual office environment with frequent sitting, walking, and standing, and occasional climbing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, crawling, and balancing.
Frequent exposure to manufacturing environment with variable noise levels and seasonal levels of humidity.
Frequent use of eye, hand, and finger coordination enabling the use of office machinery.
Oral and auditory capacity enabling interpersonal communication as well as communication through automated devices such as the telephone.
TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to travel occasionally domestically.

Process Studies (Capability) , including Planning, Organizing, Performing and Reporting

Job Summary
Summary:
The Quality Engineer position is responsible for ensuring quality of manufactured goods from delivery to final product by continually assessing process and recommending improvements in our contract manufacturing setting. This position is also responsible for the design and implementation of quality parameters relating to Electronic Contract Manufacturing.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the listed essential duties and responsibilities:
Drive and implement quality activities to meet company expectations, customer expectations; maintain consistent documentation and continuous improvements on manufacturing internally and externally
Design and implement methods and procedures for inspecting, testing, and evaluating the precision and accuracy of products and/or production equipment
Coordinate activities associated with “first article build” of new products, ensuring that fabricated items are traceable to documented standards at the time of release of product into the production mode
Analyze Corrective Action Reports (CARs) and Return Material Authorization (RMAs) and recommends additional corrective actions; support manufacturing to minimize non-value added processes like RMAs, rework, scrapping
Create device failure analysis and root-cause analysis to investigate and evaluate defective devices/circuits, conduct performance characterization testing and modeling, and recommend changes to eliminate future failures
Audit ISO standards in all departments of the company and serve as the ISO management representative of Megaforce
Required to conform to safety regulations and procedures to maintain a safe working environment at all times
Works directly with manufacturing to schedule and control inspection activities to enforce requirements as specified by raw materials, ingredients, product and package specifications, and regulatory agencies
Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Quality Engineering or Quality Assurance or an equivalent degree from an accredited institution; or a minimum of 3-4 years of related experience and/or training; or an adequate combination of education and experience that would demonstrate the capability to perform the role.
Knowledge and Skills:
Must have specific knowledge of ISO 9001:2008 or ISO 13485 (medical), Traceability, IPC-610 Class II, III, and J-STD
Strong verbiage of contract manufacturing process (A – Z)
Strong verbiage of various quality and manufacturing reporting, graphs, Excel data, schematics, etc.
Proficient communication skills to work with production personnel, PMs, and engineers
Strong adaptability to implement engineering and customer changes and maximize efficiencies
Strong time management skills to balance various project build simultaneously
Strong adaptability to implement engineering and customer changes and maximize efficiencies
Ability to prioritize and execute multiple tasks in a demanding environment, demonstrate good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
Provides inspection service to support manufacturing/engineering requests. Ensures adequate and accurate inspection for incoming components and special requests. Coordinates timely disposition of rejected raw materials. Gives direction to Quality Technicians and Parts Inspectors.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordinates non-standard inspections and folder updates, evaluates lab capabilities vs. requests.
Maintains and updates electronic check sheets per drawing and/or HY specification changes.
Non-conforming material: Pursues disposition of material; communicates requests for material returns with suppliers; sends samples; locates material within Oracle; maintains NCR log and documents; coordinates third party inspection.
Initiates and processes supplier chargebacks.
Maintains proficiency and competency testing for Quality Lab personnel. Monitors adherence to requirements of 17025 and TS16949.
Provides direction and scheduling for lab personnel.
Directs 6S activities; assists with inspections and follows up material paperwork issues.
Coordinates and identifies material per inspection zone requirements.
Coordinates post receiving alerts.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS*:
Bachelor’s degree in related field, preferred* plus a minimum of three years supervisory and quality experience required. Demonstrable knowledge of optical inspection machine, calipers, micrometers, indicators, optical comparator, and height gage required. Regulatory and Quality System requirements/standards knowledge required. Requires excellent communication skills both verbal and written, with attention to detail. Must be computer literate and have ability to manage multiple priorities.
Any equivalent combination of experience and training which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities may be substituted.
WORK ENVIRONMENT / CONDITIONS / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Work will take place in a combination office/shop environment. Employee may be required to work weekends, holidays, and be on-call on occasion. While performing the duties of this job, employees may be exposed to mechanical or chemical processes requiring the use of personnel protective equipment.
These are considered essential duties and are illustrative of those job tasks that are fundamental. Employees may be required to perform additional related duties as may be assigned by management. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

About Capgemini Engineering

Description:
We, The Body, Chassis, Interior (BCI) Quality Team are looking for a Technical Synthesis Quality Lead to join our team focused on ensuring all project quality targets are met, managing launch timelines & deliverables, and ensuring the transition to quality volume production!
Specific Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Writes the control sheets for any new part
Translates control sheets for the carry-over parts
Establishes a quality status of all the incoming parts (ensures that the inspection report is complete and that the parts comply with the definition at each stage)
Loopback with the Design Business line upon arrival of a new part to confirm the need and the nature of the change
Analyses all chassis defects detected either on incoming parts, or during the manufacturing process, or on vehicle
Performs a daily follow-up of all defects towards the project team
Participates in any Chassis line side review with the manufacturing team
Writes the process sheets for transitory solutions
Asks for any necessary deviation
Contributes to the APQP/PPAP process
Required Skills
Bachelor of Science in Engineering - Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace/Aeronautical/Biomedical/Biomechanical/Bioengineering, Chemical, Civil or Materials from an ABET-accredited university!
3-5 years of related work experience
Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to deal with a variety of people at all levels of the organization
Ability to collect and synthesize data into meaningful information and communicate clearly to all levels of the organization. Self-directed, and team-oriented with proven planning/problem-solving skills. Experience and working knowledge of computer systems and software required
Knowledge of APQP/PPAP & Supplier Quality Manual.
Statistical data analysis and metrology principles, Root Cause Analysis methods.
Knowledge of defect resolution, escalation processes, and follow-up.
Understanding of vehicle design, assembly, and process control.
Understanding of tooling and in-plant processes.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills with the ability to work with multi-functional teams.
Ability to develop an action plan and drive the procedures for issue resolution.
Proficient in Microsoft Suite and Google, We prefer Teamcenter CAD.
Self-motivated. Able to meet deadlines with the ability to work with multi-functional teams.
High level of proficiency in English (speaking, reading, writing)

Position: QA Testing Engineer (Mostly Manual)
Responsibilities:
- Develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures to ensure product quality and customer satisfaction
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define quality standards and requirements
- Conduct thorough testing of software applications, including functional, regression, and performance testing
- Create and execute test cases and test scripts to validate software functionality
- Identify and document software defects, track issues, and work with development teams to resolve them

Job Title: Supplier Quality Engineer
Department: Quality Assurance
Reports To: Quality Assurance Manager/Purchasing Manager
SUMMARY OF POSITION
The Supplier Quality Engineer will report directly to the Quality Manager with indirect report to the Purchasing Manager. The SQE is responsible for development of the supply base, including but not limited to improvement in process quality, delivery, and supplier performance metrics. The SQE will work with the Champion supply base assisting in manufacturing process control improvements, error proofing, and PFMEA development. Additional responsibilities include root cause analysis of quality escapes resulting from purchased products, productivity improvements, FAIR reviews of purchased product, issuing and reviewing corrective action requests of suppliers and on-site audits of the supply base. Expected travel is 30%-50%.
The SQE will be responsible for quality inputs and outputs from the development stage through the life of the product, working with the assigned quality and manufacturing engineers to the specific product line.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Work with quality and purchasing in identifying key suppliers and improve the delivery and quality metrics of those suppliers.
2. Coordinate and lead on site audits at the supply chain sites.
3. Determine the need for corrective action requests with follow up visits to ensure effective implementation.
4. Collect and analyze process data and supplier performance history to identify chronic supply chain deficits and correct problems for trends leading to opportunities for improvement projects and cost reduction.
5. Develop and improve procedures controlling the outsourcing process to improve the effectiveness and FPY of purchased product.
6. Organize and lead Improvement Projects to refine process control, correct process problems, reduce scrap, and improve on time delivery.
7. Monitor supply base KPI’s and report monthly to Champion leadership, develop and monitor supplier scorecards for key Champion suppliers.
8. Work with the Champion receiving inspection to develop quality plans and review supplier FAIR submissions.
9. Work with the Purchasing and Quality Managers on supplier selection and development.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
B.S. in Engineering, Management, or Technology.
Minimum Three (3) years Supplier Quality Engineering/Development experience; Automotive or Aerospace industry experience a plus.
Must have experience in APQP, PPAP, PFMEA, GD&T, FAIR and formal problem solving methodology.
Good written and verbal communication skill.
